pullRequest.title: Add grouped_execution to kudu connector
pullRequest.bodyText: Add grouped execution to kudu connector, controlled by session param kudu.grouped_execution=true;

nodes.bodyText: Can we make it as OptionalInt so tables which doesn't have bucketing can pass it as empty ?
Instead of removing the bucket, can we have a counter which gets incremented so that it would be helpful in isFInished ?
Can you please correct the indentation ?
check if the number is not negative ?
Inline this line
rnn checks for the the fields
Why not bucketIds?
We can check the schemaName and tableName right ?
we can inject ClassLoaderSafeNodePartitioningProvider directly so we can directly get Connector instance usiing injector.getInstance
Instead of maintaining KuduSessionProperties can we maintain List<PropertyMetadata<?>> sessionProperties
Can we move this to a new line ?
Can we import PartitionSchema.HashBucketSchema directly
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,4 +41,17 @@ public static PartialRow decodeRangePartitionKey(Schema schema, PartitionSchema
     {
         return KeyEncoder.decodeRangePartitionKey(schema, partitionSchema, key);
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Returns the bucket of the row for the given hash bucket schema. All columns
+     * in the hash bucket schema must be set in the row.
+     *
+     * @param row the row containing hash schema columns
+     * @param hashSchema the hash schema
+     * @return the hash bucket of the row
+     */
+    public static int getHashBucket(PartialRow row, PartitionSchema.HashBucketSchema hashSchema)

checkArgument(bucketColumnIdIndexes.size() == bucketChannelTypes.size()) ?
checkArgument(bucketCount == bucketColumnIdIndexes.size())? If so do you need bucketCount at all?
why do you pass field bucketChannelTypes to a method? This field is already accessible there.
checkArgument(types.size() == page. getChannelCount())

Please extract this loop to separate method then:
        List<Integer> bucketIds = this.hashBucketSchemas.stream()
                      .map(this::yourNewFancyMethod)
                      .collect(...);

Rename i to channel
How about TINYINT and SMALLINT?
Extract variable for this.bucketColumnIdIndexes.get(i)
Why not to use java.util.Arrays#hashCode(java.lang.Object[]) instead of calculating hash on your own?

kudu.grouped-execution.enabled?
Let's have it disabled by default, instead of naming this experimental.
you have missing return this;
why do we have bucket numbers in generic split? Shouldn't this be only available when grouped execution is enabled?
either all arguments are in separate line or none.
Please narrow the exception type that catch?
Shouldn't we fail instead?
Please move this method to KuduTable, so you can kuduTable.supportGroupedExecution()
please move this method under the usage
why not to simply pass handle to KuduBucketFunction constructor?
why not toStringHelper?
do you need to equals and hashCode at all here?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            "Experimental: Kudu: Enable kudu connector grouped_execution.",
          
          
            
                            "Enable grouped execution",
final
splitMap -> groupedSplits
KuduBucketedSplitSource?
why kuduSplit can be null?

the best would be to remove entries from splitMap. Notice that this code is vulnerable, in case you are asked for the bucket you might return same split twice and say in isFinished that you finished even if not all splits were procesed.
It is not system property, but catalog property
It would be the best to make it a default session in kudu query runner you are using here. I mean it would be best to pass this session to createKuduQueryRunner
How did you verify grouped execution actually worked? This assertion will pass disregarding if it is enabled or not.
What this assertion proves? Why you expect certain number of exchange stages?
can we reuse io.prestosql.plugin.kudu.AbstractKuduIntegrationSmokeTest?
inline partitionSchema
please inline this method

inline bucketCount

commit.message:
Add grouped_execution to kudu connector

When the input tables are already partitioned on the join key or aggregation key, make Presto could process a subset (group) of the partitions of the data at a time.

nodes.bodyText: Any reason bucketCount gets ignored here?
